definition: harmful and without benefit (idiom); more harm than good

sentences.english: It's more than just words: it's just tears and rain.
sentences.chinese: 多說無益，就讓眼淚和雨水來證明。

sentences.english: The prophets prophesied by Baal, following worthless idols .
sentences.chinese: 先知借巴力說預言，隨從無益的神。

sentences.english: The barrenness of their effort is due to poor management.
sentences.chinese: 他們努力的徒勞無益歸咎於管理不善。

sentences.english: True philosophy was supplanted by dogmatic opinions. The pundits took delight in vain polemics .
sentences.chinese: 梵文學者爲了徒勞無益的辯論術而感到高興。

sentences.english: Avoid malcontents and pessimists. They dray you down and contribute nothing.
sentences.chinese: 避免結交不滿意者和悲觀者，他們對你有害無益。

sentences.english: The foreign aid to the country was believed to be nothing but a white elephant.
sentences.chinese: 那個國度得到的外助豈但無益而且成了繁重的累贅。

sentences.english: The matter itself I could not deny, and vain was every endeavour to soften it.
sentences.chinese: 事情本身我無法否認，企圖大事化小也是徒勞無益的。

sentences.english: Avoid malcontents and pessimists. They drag you down and contribute nothing.
sentences.chinese: 避免結交不滿意者和悲觀者，他們對你有害無益。

sentences.english: Sacrifice yourself, on-time, loyal to argue, is from.
sentences.chinese: 犧牲小我，顧全大局，爭論無益，忠恕是從。

sentences.english: Another fallacy seldom contradicted is that exports are good, imports bad.
sentences.chinese: 還有一個極少被反駁的謬論即出口有益，進口無益。

sentences.english: Catch the wind with a net.
Unprofitable eloquence is like the cypress,which is great and tall,but bears no fruit.
sentences.chinese: 無益的雄辯猶如高大的柏樹，不會結果。

sentences.english: Was saying is useless, perhaps silences is the best explanation.
sentences.chinese: 在多說無益的時候，也許沉默就是最好的解釋。

sentences.english: Well, in that case, there is nothing more to be said.
sentences.chinese: 如果是這樣，多說也無益。

sentences.english: Why should we spend so much time on the profitless matter?
sentences.chinese: 我們爲什麼要花如此多的時間在這無益的事情上？

sentences.english: For a lost thing cares nothing.

definition: to have a voracious desire for/to covet/greedy/corrupt
to cling to/to be reluctant to give up (sth)/to have a fondness for (an indulgence etc)
to toil/labor/laborer/to put sb to trouble (of doing sth)/meritorious deed/to console (Taiwan pr. [lao4] for this sense)
to abolish/to abandon/to abrogate/to discard/to depose/to oust/crippled/abandoned/waste
